title: 'Rust' Crew Cite Uncertainty Over Safety Check of Gun
summary: Recollections by Joel Souza and a crew member about Thursday's fatal incident on the set are revealed in a new affidavit. Santa Fe, N.M.-Alec Baldwin practiced pulling a revolver from his holster, showing the director how he planned to reach across his body, draw the gun and point it at the camera, according to a search-warrant affidavit released Sunday.

title: Xi's 'Common Prosperity' in Theory and Practice
summary: Newly released remarks warn about the dangers of 'welfarism' and government dependence. Investors had, over the past 30 years, grown so accustomed to ignoring rhetoric about communism from nominally-communist China that a leader firmly putting equality at the heart of his economic agenda has caused more than a little heartburn. The Oct. 15 release of a fuller transcript of President Xi Jinping's mid-August remarks on "common prosperity" therefore piqued considerable interest.

title: Prop Firearms Were Accidentally Discharged on 'Rust' Before Fatal Incident
summary: A set medic's report offers more details about aftermath of fatal shooting of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins. In the days before the fatal shooting on the set of the Alec Baldwin movie "Rust," prop guns used in the Western film accidentally discharged at least twice, according to people familiar with the daily operations of the production.

title: A Banking Regulator Who Hates Banks
summary: The left wants everyone to ignore what Saule Omarova believes.. If you want to revolutionize the U.S. banking system, should you be in charge of regulating it? Apparently Democrats think so, as they rally to defend President Biden's nominee for Comptroller of the Currency, Saule Omarova.

title: BlackRock's Wish Is Your Command
summary: The lords of finance now want the SEC to coerce even private companies with their ESG agenda.. It's not enough for socially enlightened masters of finance like BlackRock and Nasdaq to push around publicly traded companies. Now they want the Securities and Exchange Commission to impose their social and political agenda on all companies, including private firms.

title: The Election for Pennsylvania's High Court
summary: The court that roiled the 2020 campaign will get a new Justice on Nov. 2.. After Pennsylvania's 2020 election mess, the state Supreme Court needs an injection of judicial restraint, and Judge Kevin Brobson wants to deliver the first dose. The Nov. 2 ballot includes a partisan election for an open seat on the high court. Judge Brobson, who sits on an appeals bench a step lower, is the GOP nominee. His website says he'll defend "the law as it is written."

title: A Judge for First Principles
summary: An award named for Justice Thomas goes to Judge Silberman.. Clarence Thomas is celebrating his 30th anniversary on the Supreme Court. And how fitting it is that the Gray Center at Antonin Scalia Law School at George Mason University honored that milestone last week with its first annual Justice Clarence Thomas First Principles Award. Even more fitting is that the first honoree is Laurence Silberman of the D.C. Circuit Court of Appeals.

title: It's Madness to Quarantine Schoolchildren
summary: The CDC's policies hinder learning and provide no meaningful reduction in Covid-19 transmission.. Portland, Ore.

title: The U.N. Should Open Its Door to Democratic Taiwan
summary: Expelled 50 years ago to make room for the Beijing government, today it deserves full recognition.. Taiwan wasn't always a pariah at the United Nations. For more than 20 years the Taipei-based government represented China there, including on the Security Council. That changed on Oct. 25, 1971, when the General Assembly voted to admit delegates from the People's Republic of China. The Republic of China lost its seat and has been on the outside looking in ever since. Resolution 2758 marked the beginning of Beijing's assault on Taiwan's international status.

title: The Melting Pot and the Barber's Chair
summary: I've been getting my haircut in the same place since I was a kid, but the scissors have been passed more than once.. Pittsburgh

title: Who Funds Violent Latin American Politics?
summary: Extradition of two former Venezuelan operatives could unlock the answer.. Venezuelan dictator Nicolás Maduro is hopping mad about the extradition to the U.S. this month of Alex Saab. Caracas's former financial go-between was detained by police in Cape Verde in 2020 on an Interpol arrest order. In retaliation for the extradition, Mr. Maduro immediately sent six former employees of Citgo, who were under house arrest, to the notorious Helicoide prison.

title: Crypto Is Shedding Its Tether
summary: John Law issued bank notes willy-nilly. Are stablecoin issuers doing the same?. The launch of the first bitcoin-focused exchange-traded fund last week proves crypto bulls need to meet John Law. The Scottish gambler, economist and financier is likely why so few top French banks have Banque in their name. Instead, there is Crédit Agricole, Société Générale and Crédit Mutuel. Law's Banque Générale, later renamed Banque Royale, issued bank notes out of thin air, then royally blew up in 1720 and destroyed the French economy. The reputation of French banks has never fully recovered.

title: 'The Chancellor' Review: An Ode to Angela Merkel
summary: Ms. Merkel's admirers think of her as Europe's moral center. Her record is more complex.. To label Kati Marton's biography of Angela Merkel a hagiography would not be fair-not entirely. That said, when she writes of the chancellor being "too busy saving the world" to have much time for strolling in the woods, the expression may be less of a rhetorical flourish than it should. "The Chancellor" is an impressively researched but, in many respects, devotional work-the reflection of a worshipful establishment consensus that will eventually seem absurd.

title: Texas Drag-Race Crash Kills Two Children
summary: Accident at Airport Race Wars 2 event also injures eight people, including 3-month-old girl. A driver lost control of a vehicle at a Texas drag-racing event Saturday and struck a group of spectators, killing two children and injuring eight other people, according to authorities.

title: Biden Pares Back Policy Goals in Search of a Deal
summary: Eager for an agreement by the end of October, the president has been willing to compromise on key planks of his domestic agenda. WASHINGTON-With a series of deadlines approaching, President Biden's increased involvement in talks over his sweeping social-policy agenda shows the line he is walking between being a pragmatic deal maker, with hopes of delivering tangible political wins, and his desire to enact transformative, long-term progressive policies.

title: Saudi Arabia Pledges 'Net Zero' Carbon Emissions by 2060
summary: Goal doesn't include emissions from the massive amounts of oil the kingdom exports to other countries. RIYADH-Saudi Arabia pledged to reduce its net carbon emissions to zero by 2060 ahead of a United Nations climate summit next weekend, as one of the world's top oil producers resists calls to cut investment in new oil-and-gas development.

title: Economy Week Ahead: Central Banks, GDP, Consumer Spending
summary: A reading on third-quarter U.S. economic growth is among a raft of data expected in the coming days. Gross domestic product data from the U.S. and eurozone this week will show how sharply economic growth slowed in the third quarter.

title: Facebook's Internal Chat Boards Show Politics Often at Center of Decision Making
summary: Resume Subscription. In June 2020, when America was rocked by protests over the death of George Floyd at the hands of a Minneapolis police officer, a Facebook employee posted a message on the company's racial-justice chat board: "Get Breitbart out of News Tab."

title: Solar and Wind Force Poverty on Africa
summary: Letting us use reliable energy doesn't mean a climate disaster.. Africa can't sacrifice its future prosperity for Western climate goals. The continent should balance its energy mix, not rush straight toward renewables-even though that will likely frustrate some of those gathering at next week's global climate conference in Glasgow.

title: Don't Politicize the Fed, Reappoint Chairman Jerome Powell
summary: Lael Brainard should get the nod in four years and be made vice chairman for supervision now.. President Biden has too much on his plate. But there is one important task he should handle quickly: reappointing Jerome Powell as chairman of the Federal Reserve.

title: Colombia Captures Drug-Trafficking Kingpin Wanted by U.S.
summary: Country's president says seizure of warlord rivals police slaying of Medellín cartel chief Pablo Escobar. BOGOTA, Colombia-Colombia said it has arrested its most-wanted drug-trafficking kingpin, the leader of a rural militia of more than 1,000 fighters who American prosecutors say oversaw a lucrative cocaine-smuggling network to the U.S.

title: Retirement Second Acts: He Used to Sell Pet Supplies. Now He Writes About Wine.
summary: Don Sonderling says his new work is mostly "making friends over a glass of wine and talking.". When Don Sonderling started working some 50 years ago, he did exactly what was expected of him. He entered the family business of wholesale pet supplies.

title: What If I Already Pay My Fair Share in Tax?
summary: Half my income is enough-but not for President Biden.. Clifford Asness hits the nail on the head ("Biden's Real Tax Target Isn't the Superrich," op-ed, Oct. 20). President Biden conveniently confuses the superrich with high wage-earners, and falsely portrays the latter as tax evaders who "don't pay their fair share."

title: What Colin Powell Knew About City College
summary: CCNY and the rest of CUNY are an unparalleled engine of social mobility.. Your editorial "Colin L. Powell" (Oct. 19), noted how he attended City College, part of the City University of New York (CUNY). Unfortunately, you claimed that Powell attended City College "when that institution had high standards and was still a path to upward mobility."

title: Doctors and Patients Should Decide Together
summary: Retreat and paternalism aren't the only options for physicians.. Kudos to Talya Miron-Shatz for illuminating the dark side of medical consumerism ("Can Patients Decide Their Own Care?" Review, Oct. 9). If physicians can't or won't use their specialized education, knowledge and experience to help patients make informed decisions, what role do they wish to play? Fortunately, there is a middle ground between this approach and medical paternalism: shared decision-making. Physicians share risks and benefits, and patients share values and preferences-resulting in a collaborative conclusion.

title: Don't Count on Iran Stopping at a Nuclear Weapon
summary: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has God whispering in his ears.. Regarding Reuel Marc Gerecht and Ray Takeyh's "Iran Won't Stop Until It Has a Nuclear Weapon" (op-ed, Oct. 20): Iran won't stop when it has a nuclear weapon. Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has God whispering in his ear. If Iran obtains a nuclear weapon, it will use it to threaten and bully its neighbors. Eventually, it could even detonate it against an "infidel" power. That this would mean the end of the 4,000-year-old Persian civilization is of no matter to zealots and despots taking orders from God.

title: The West's Climate Policy Subsidizes the Kremlin
summary: At least we can pretend to use less dirty energy.. Regarding Walter Russell Mead's "Energy Crisis Hobbles Biden's Green Agenda" (Global View, Oct. 19) and several of your recent editorials: The West has spent the last four or so decades paying the Chinese to become our capable adversary, simply because we are addicted to cheap stuff. Apparently we think that is going so well for us now that we want to pay Russia, too.

title: Endemic Covid-19 Has Arrived in Portugal. This Is What It Looks Like.
summary: Resume Subscription. LISBON-In this soccer-crazed capital of a soccer-obsessed nation, the stadiums are full again. Portugal, a country ravaged earlier in the year by the Delta variant of the coronavirus, now has the highest Covid-19 vaccination rate in Europe and offers a glimpse of a country trying to come to grips with what is increasingly looking like an endemic virus.

title: Democrats Eye Tax on Billionaires' Unrealized Gains
summary: The proposal, which would likely affect fewer than 1,000 of the wealthiest U.S. taxpayers, would help pay for Biden's social policy and climate legislation. WASHINGTON-A new annual tax on billionaires' unrealized capital gains is likely to be included to help pay for the vast social policy and climate package lawmakers hope to finalize this week, senior Democrats said Sunday.

title: Bug Question: To Smush or Not to Smush the Spotted Lanternfly?
summary: States want people to kill the pretty pests, but some feel conflicted about 'that murderous rage of squashing'. An all-out war is being waged against spotted lanternflies. That has created some conflicted killers.

title: A Divisive Building's Unifying Revamp
summary: The expanded and renovated Martin Building at the Denver Art Museum has been thoughtfully retouched by architects sensitive to the style of its original designer, Gio Ponti.. Denver

title: Unwelcome Add-Ons to a Grand Collection
summary: The Denver Art Museum's collection is world-class, but changing priorities in its redesign intrude on, rather than elevate, the works on view..

title: What Solitaire Reveals About My Life
summary: The card game has played different roles at different times-often revolving around the people I have loved. Every summer, during my grandparents' annual visit to our home in Connecticut, my grandfather would spend mornings and afternoons playing solitaire at a table in the living room. I don't remember him ever speaking. Instead he would silently, carefully turn over each card, scanning the top row back and forth looking for a match before moving on to the next card.

title: Covid-19 Vaccines for Younger Children Could Be Available in Early November, Fauci Says
summary: U.S. officials prepare for a rapid rollout for children ages 5 to 11 once the FDA and CDC give their approval. WASHINGTON-The country's top public-health experts on Sunday predicted a rapid rollout of the coronavirus vaccine for younger children if regulators move quickly to give their approval in the coming weeks.

title: Turkey's Erdogan Threatens to Expel 10 Western Ambassadors, Including U.S. Envoy
summary: The diplomats had recently called for the release of a Turkish philanthropist who has been jailed since 2017. Turkey's President Recep Tayyip Erdogan threatened to expel the U.S. ambassador and the top envoys of nine other Western countries who called for the release of a jailed philanthropist, in a move that could further strain ties between the two NATO allies.

title: Talks Collapse Over Sale of Italian Bank Monte dei Paschi
summary: End of negotiations between Italy's government and UniCredit leaves little time to find a solution for the lender. Monthslong talks between the Italian government and bank UniCredit SpA over the sale of nationalized lender Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA have ended, UniCredit and the government said Sunday.

title: For Beautiful Spring Flowers: A Guide to Planning and Planting Bulbs
summary: Resume Subscription. One chilly October day a few years ago, I planted winter aconite bulbs, several dozen of them, under a magnolia tree in my yard.

title: 10 Podcasts for Older Adults That Promise to Entertain-and Enlighten
summary: From retirement wisdom to movies to revisiting the past, these podcasts speak to issues of particular interest to those of a certain age. Podcasts have come of age for listeners of all ages.

title: French Nationalist TV Host Éric Zemmour, Inspired by Trump, Surges in Polls
summary: Resume Subscription. PARIS-As a television talk-show host and pundit, Éric Zemmour built a devoted following on France's far right with years of barbed criticism of immigrants, Muslims and leftist politicians.

title: Millions of Workers Stay Home to Watch Young Children as Daycares Struggle
summary: The fallout from more than 100,000 missing child-care workers is stymieing company efforts to hire and sidelining some women's careers. Children across the U.S. have returned to school in person and many daycare centers have reopened with vaccinated staffers. Still, a shortage of child-care workers is sending ripples across the U.S. workforce, stymieing employers as they try to hire more workers and sidelining the careers of women who would otherwise opt to remain in the labor force.

title: Covid-19 Sets Back China's Plans to Rebalance Its Economy
summary: Pandemic-era boom in demand for Chinese goods boosted exports but made the country even more reliant on trade. China's yearslong trade war with the U.S. convinced its leaders the country needed to move faster to expand its domestic consumer market so its economy couldn't be whipsawed so easily by shifts in Western demand.

title: Gambling Ads Become the New Normal for American Sports
summary: Some regulators and industry watchdogs express concern, while sports-betting companies say advertising is done responsibly. The gambling industry's deluge of sports-betting ads and free-money offers on television, radio and online, is beginning to concern regulators.

title: Gruden Email Scandal Amps Up Criticism of NFL Investigation
summary: The offensive emails have shined a new spotlight on the lack of transparency from the investigation into the Washington Football Team, with renewed calls for the NFL to release details on the misconduct inside the franchise. The email scandal that torpedoed Las Vegas Raiders coach Jon Gruden's career has reignited a bigger problem for the National Football League: its failure to publicly release the findings of an investigation into workplace misconduct at the Washington Football Team.

title: Bitcoin ETF's Success Could Come at Fundholders' Expense
summary: The first exchange-traded fund based on bitcoin futures is rolling up assets, but traders say the ProShares fund's structure makes it a sitting duck for 'front-running'. There are signs that the bitcoin futures market isn't big enough for a planned wave of crypto exchange-traded funds.

title: Companies Grapple With Disclosing Climate-Change Risks
summary: Businesses are racing to understand and communicate their climate risks as investor pressure grows and regulators consider making such disclosures mandatory. When Bank of Montreal began considering how climate change could affect its business in 2019, it turned to others for help. The bank collaborated with a climate mapping company, used third-party software to study how its portfolios would fare under different scenarios and worked with academics at a Canadian university on a climate-risk research project.

title: Gender-Neutral Toys Gain Ground
summary: California law looks to remove gender from toy marketing; new research into children's play sheds light on gender biases. New efforts are under way to eliminate what some toy makers, parents and advocates see as a longstanding issue in the toy industry: gender bias.

title: Companies Turn to Carbon Offsets to Hit 'Net Zero'
summary: Resume Subscription. Companies are snapping up carbon offsets, but the patchwork of informal markets serving that appetite lack consistent standards and oversight, some businesses say, making their effectiveness in cutting emissions hard to gauge.

title: Paul McCartney's 'The Lyrics': A Life Revealed in Song
summary: In a new two-volume memoir, Paul McCartney looks back over a lifetime of creative output. Here, a closer look at 10 illuminating songs.. In the foreword to The Lyrics: 1956 to The Present, Paul McCartney says that he's repeatedly been asked to write his memoirs "but the time has never been right." As he looked back across his life, though he did not have a diary to refer to, "what I do have is my songs-hundreds of them-which serve much the same purpose." In 2015, he began meeting with poet Paul Muldoon and going through his recollections about his compositions with the Beatles and as a solo artist. The results are the 154 selections included in this two-volume collection. Here, a look at McCartney's discussion of 10 of those songs-and a distilled view into his life and creative process.

title: Home Prices Rise, and Single People Are Running Out of Houses to Buy
summary: With mortgage rates remaining low, plenty of singles are seeking homes. But the supply of entry-level housing is near a five-decade low.. Single people hoping to buy homes in the current housing market are short on options.

title: Shippers Find New Supply-Chain Hurdles at Alternate Ports
summary: Shortages of trucking, rail and warehouse capacity at alternative gateways cause headaches for importers seeking to avoid the logjam at the Southern California ports. When Flexport Inc. learned in the past month that an ocean carrier planned to shift cargo from the congested operations at the Port of Los Angeles to little Port Hueneme some 80 miles up the California coast, the freight forwarder found that trucking companies weren't ready to go along with the changing direction of the imports.

title: Larry David, Style Icon? How His Boring-Dad Look Got Trendy
summary: The 'Curb Your Enthusiasm' star's recent appearance at a New York Fashion Week show and an HBO collaboration with the streetwear emporium Kith have positioned the normcore hero closer to the glittery fashion world.. On Sept. 12, Larry David, the fusspot star of HBO's long-running awk-com "Curb Your Enthusiasm," sat in the front row of the Staud fashion show in New York City. He did not appear to enjoy himself. As models swooshed past in buoyant primary-colored clothes, the 74-year-old comedian leaned forward, plugged his ears and stared straight at the floor. In an October appearance on Jimmy Kimmel Live!, Mr. David explained that the music at the Staud show was just too loud for him. (Through an HBO representative, Mr. David declined to comment for this article.)

title: How the Atlanta Braves Overcame the Loss of Their MVP and Made the World Series
summary: The Braves beat the Dodgers in the NLCS to advance to the Series, capping a remarkable recovery from the loss of superstar Ronald Acuña Jr. in July.. When superstar outfielder Ronald Acuña Jr. suffered a season-ending knee injury in July, the Atlanta Braves knew that no one player could replace him. So they replaced him with four.

title: The U.K. Ditched Coal and Left Itself a New Set of Challenges
summary: Resume Subscription. BLYTH, England-Coal from mines around this northeastern English port town made the U.K. an industrial and imperial superpower in the 19th century. In the 21st, the country has all but ditched the fuel.

title: ESG Gains Could Buy Better Terms in Insurance Program
summary: Marsh McLennan and others seek to push clients for stronger climate-change disclosures and representations. U.S. companies deemed to have superior environmental, social and governance practices will be eligible for improved terms on directors-and-officers liability insurance policies under an initiative by a leading broker.

title: Stanford Joins Group Offering Classes to Disadvantaged High-School Students
summary: Program is part of colleges' efforts to diversify undergraduate ranks; it attacks what admissions calls 'under-matching'. Stanford University joined a group of about a dozen highly selective colleges and universities that offer digitally taught college courses in an effort to target academically talented high-school students in economically disadvantaged communities.

title: Rhode Island Set to Be First State to Pilot Safe-Injection Sites for Drug Users
summary: Sites for users of fentanyl, other drugs would test strategy of harm reduction over criminalization. Rhode Island plans to create supervised spaces for users to inject illegal drugs, in a big test of the idea that reducing harm to drug users is more effective than criminalization.

title: U.S. Companies Bet Shoppers Will Keep Paying Higher Prices
summary: P&G, Nestlé, Chipotle say price increases haven't turned customers away, and they expect that to continue even as inflationary pressures mount. Some of the world's biggest companies are betting consumers will keep paying more for products from coffee to toilet paper.

title: Qatar Voices Frustration Over U.S. Response to Drone Request
summary: Qatar, a big U.S. weapons buyer, has been seeking U.S. approval of a deal for armed Predator drones for more than a year. WASHINGTON-The Qatari government, which has aided in the evacuation of tens of thousands of Afghans and backed American counterterrorism operations in the Middle East, is voicing frustration with the Biden administration for slow-walking a request to buy advanced drones from the U.S.

title: Negotiating Your Salary or a New Role? Ask 'What Would Machiavelli Do?'
summary: Most Popular News. People aiming for higher pay or a promotion may find winning career advice in a 500-year-old treatise that is often assigned reading for college freshmen.
